study_information.title: Chronic trawling impact - Kattegat - benthic surface sediment - meiofauna
study_information.study_abstract: Raw sequence reads from chronic trawling impact study in Kattegat region focusing on benthic surface sediment meiofauna communities

taxonomy_classification.genetic_code: Translation table 11 (Bacterial, Archaeal and Plant Plastid)
taxonomy_classification.lineage: unclassified entries; unclassified sequences; metagenomes; ecological metagenomes

major_groups.name: Metazoa
major_groups.description: Marine animals including nematodes, copepods, and other meiofauna

major_groups.name: Stramenopiles
major_groups.description: Diverse group including diatoms and other protists

major_groups.name: Rhizaria
major_groups.description: Amoeboid protists important in marine ecosystems

ecological_context.study_focus: Impact assessment of fishing activities on meiofaunal communities
ecological_context.biodiversity_note: High diversity of microscopic metazoans and protists typical of marine sediments

analysis_results.interpretation: High proportion of novel or poorly characterized sequences indicates understudied marine meiofauna diversity. Low similarity to references suggests potential new species or genera in this ecosystem.
analysis_results.novelty_significance: The low assignment rate (0%) and broad taxonomic groupings (Metazoa, Stramenopiles, Rhizaria) suggest these sequences represent poorly characterized or potentially novel lineages within marine sediment communities.
